page.title: 02Arable Farming-Boars Hill
page.content: Well over half the total area is given over to arable farming,the chief crops being wheat and barley. Few root crops are grown on a large scale. In recent years oil seed rape has been grown giving a brilliant yellow blaze to the countryside when the crop flowers in May.Oil from the seed is used to produce cooking oil and in the production of certain cosmetics. The residual fibre is used to produce cattle food for winter feeding. Much of the grass grown is used to produce hay and silage also used for winter feed for cattle.
